column3:
I misunderstood the invert feature. the really good thing was that the 
author was very responsive and told me how worrked.
Not sure how to convert decimal to binary using this app.

EDIT: I searched long and hard for a satisfactory calculator...and this is 
by far the best one. It isn't completely perfect as it struggles with very 
large calculations. For example if you do 99! Mod 101 it will give you 18 
but the answer is in fact 1. For now it's a 4/5

EDIT:  A new version addressed my concerns, although i have to make a change in the settings. Overall its great, so thank you to the developer Sam for a really quick response! [original review:>To me, the +/- button should always change the sign of whatever value is currently displayed, whether t...Full ReviewEDIT:  A new version addressed my concerns, although i have to make a change in the settings. Overall its great, so thank you to the developer Sam for a really quick response! [original review:>To me, the +/- button should always change the sign of whatever value is currently displayed, whether that value is the result of a calculation, or an entry typed in by the user. That's it. Pressing +/- should not trigger the start of a new line and a completely new calculation that starts with zero. I might want to reuse the last result. Otherwise this is a great calculator, and also looks great.]

Really good. Got great support and got the square root thing figured out. 
Getting used to the remove function. That's a little different than the 
past but does allow you to keep several figures at once up in accessible 
memory.

I am moving my rating from 4 stars to 5 stars. I looked at every scientific calculator on Google Play. I immediately ruled out any calculator that is not free or that has ads or in-app purchases. Next I ruled out any calculator that does not have a traditional/classic style keyboard. I then ruled ou...Full ReviewI am moving my rating from 4 stars to 5 stars. I looked at every scientific calculator on Google Play. I immediately ruled out any calculator that is not free or that has ads or in-app purchases. Next I ruled out any calculator that does not have a traditional/classic style keyboard. I then ruled out one calculator that performs the exponent function on both the exponent key and the reciprocal key. I ended up with 4 calculators. Each of the 4 has functionality on the free version that is not available on the other 3. In the end, I consider CalcTastic the BEST.
Seriously one of my most used apps, please keep up the good work! The scientific layout is perfect
I used this apps in 2 yrs it was good. The alignment of solving numbers top to down and amazed me after making a screen shot.problem solved.thank you

A lot better than the calc app pre-installed on my phone. It lacks some functions, like summation and sequence product, matrices, etc. - but it has so much more.   Likes: fast, user-friendly, full screen, big buttons, everything is easy to find - including the units converter and list of constants. ...Full ReviewA lot better than the calc app pre-installed on my phone. It lacks some functions, like summation and sequence product, matrices, etc. - but it has so much more.   Likes: fast, user-friendly, full screen, big buttons, everything is easy to find - including the units converter and list of constants. Being able to switch between basic and scientific easily, and all the different 'skins' are really nice.   Dislike: doesn't seem to be a way to recall a previous expression for quick editing.

Great job! For me the best calculator out there. I needed the standard AES input of a scientific calculator, but with a simple basic mode, clean UI and clear outdoor legibility. And yours fitted the bill wonderfully. An option to display only the answer, without stacking or any other info. in large ...Full ReviewGreat job! For me the best calculator out there. I needed the standard AES input of a scientific calculator, but with a simple basic mode, clean UI and clear outdoor legibility. And yours fitted the bill wonderfully. An option to display only the answer, without stacking or any other info. in large clear fonts would be perfect. Thank you.

Needed a calculator real quick for a square root calculation. Not having done any algebra in years I was worried I would have issues with interface / order of operations, but everything was super intuitive. Thanks so much for making this!!

Great calculator!  Two suggestions: change its Google Play Store name to CalcTastic instead of the generic "Scientific Calculator", which is more a description; and change the SWAP key name to "X<>Y" with some stylized symbol for the "<>", because "swap" is somewhat ambiguous.
Thanks for being completely free and ad free. This came to my rescue during online tests and homework. I thought it worked great for the calculations I needed it for anyway. :)

Needed a good RPN calculator for my phone that has similar functionality as my HP-41CV back at the office. This app does the job and has a nice looking interface. Very responsive to button taps, with lots of features.

It would be nicer if the exponential notation is displayed in a more conventional form. For example, instead of "6.022E23" it is better to have "6.022 √ó 10 23" (23 should be superscripted of course).

Great calc. Love the theme support but I don't like not being able to customize the font: a dot-matrix and a 7-segment fonts should be included. And for the sake of realism, you should replace the hamburger menu icon with a fake brand logo and get rid of the upper bar buttons as these shortcuts are ...Full ReviewGreat calc. Love the theme support but I don't like not being able to customize the font: a dot-matrix and a 7-segment fonts should be included. And for the sake of realism, you should replace the hamburger menu icon with a fake brand logo and get rid of the upper bar buttons as these shortcuts are included on the keypad. All in all, it weirdly reminds me of RealCalc (the overall look -especially the Retro theme- and settings menu are almost twins). Maybe I'll eventually upgrade

It is very easy to use, performs statistical calculations, has nice big easy-to-read fonts etc. I particularly like the "Stack " concept where it stacks up the last 20 (expandable up to 5...Full ReviewI have tried a number of scientific calculators and can confidently say that this calculator is the best by far. It is very easy to use, performs statistical calculations, has nice big easy-to-read fonts etc. I particularly like the "Stack " concept where it stacks up the last 20 (expandable up to 50) operations for easy recall and further processing. Handles RPN logic for those who like to work this way. Algebraic entry displays expressions as you would see them in books. A masterpiece, I might add.

Basic but well implemented port of a calculator Has a 'live result' view of the equation being written. Shows the entire equation, even when it is long. Has a 'stack view' which works as RPN, but no advanced RPN/stack support. It would be nice to edit anywhere in an equation, which does not seem supported. I was also not able to find a way to dup...Full ReviewHas a 'live result' view of the equation being written. Shows the entire equation, even when it is long. Has a 'stack view' which works as RPN, but no advanced RPN/stack support. It would be nice to edit anywhere in an equation, which does not seem supported. I was also not able to find a way to duplicate a previously entered equation.

A few bad apples spoil the barrel I've been looking for a good scientific calculator for a looooong time. This one is closest to being my pick. The key layout is nice (I need pi and i to be easily available, not via shift), the looks are good, BUT: 1. When I type in a long expression and it contains an error, the result is just "Err...Full ReviewI've been looking for a good scientific calculator for a looooong time. This one is closest to being my pick. The key layout is nice (I need pi and i to be easily available, not via shift), the looks are good, BUT: 1. When I type in a long expression and it contains an error, the result is just "Error", with no chance to correct it by backspacing. 2. There could be an option to copy a previous equation, and modify it (even if it would be just backspacing the last number).

Very nice! I've spent the day trying calculators (over 50!) and this is by far the best balance for me. It looks nice and works nice. I have only two little complaints: - When we enter numbers with exponents they get converted to raw numbers in the equation (unless the exponent is simply too big, then it maint...Full ReviewI've spent the day trying calculators (over 50!) and this is by far the best balance for me. It looks nice and works nice. I have only two little complaints: - When we enter numbers with exponents they get converted to raw numbers in the equation (unless the exponent is simply too big, then it maintains its 0.32E99 form). I wish there was a setting to force keeping the number as I enter it. - I wish I could select an equation and edit it. Nothing fancy, just copy paste the equation to the input and allow me to change numbers and rerun it(but if you do it, please make it a textbox editable on tap, do NOT add arrow keys and waste the very nice multiline display!).  All in all thanks a lot for your application!

Nice app,but need arrow keys Nice app...but would have helped if you had provided Arrow keys to position cursor to make the small corrections in the entered data,instead of typing whole lot again just to make small corrections.This would make life easier.Please consider this in next upgrade if possible.Otherwise nice app.

Flexibility +++ Well done, have you considered allowing a stack of 4, the xyzt and some memories displayed above it. A 4 level stack would allow the ability to have the stack to keep the last value when an operator is pressed. Eg 2 enter enter enter, fills the stack, ++++++ will continuously add 2 to the x on every...Full ReviewWell done, have you considered allowing a stack of 4, the xyzt and some memories displayed above it. A 4 level stack would allow the ability to have the stack to keep the last value when an operator is pressed. Eg 2 enter enter enter, fills the stack, ++++++ will continuously add 2 to the x on every press of the + operator. Whilst the larger stacks have their use, so does a smaller one.

A bit difficult gives the right answers but its a bit tedious for your questions Pros: 1. veiw, you can see the entire question you are entering 2. sequence,  you can set the calculator to either work things out in the order you plug them in or by algebraic sequence Cons:1. brackets rarely work, the only work at th...Full Reviewgives the right answers but its a bit tedious for your questions Pros: 1. veiw, you can see the entire question you are entering 2. sequence,  you can set the calculator to either work things out in the order you plug them in or by algebraic sequence Cons:1. brackets rarely work, the only work at the begining of the problem and you can use them without a sign in front of them, kinda defeating the purpose of brackets 2. delete doesn't work,  the del button only works once and will not remove anything else.

Not sure how compatible it is with the stack design as I haven't got my head around it yet. Perhaps show the operation that lead to each line?

Excellent Calculator ***   Layout is almost perfect (more on that later). The user interface is great. I love the history and how it actually tells you what the calculations were for the shown values. I also love how you implemented the statistic calculations into the stack, what a great idea!     ***   The one thing th...Full Review***   Layout is almost perfect (more on that later). The user interface is great. I love the history and how it actually tells you what the calculations were for the shown values. I also love how you implemented the statistic calculations into the stack, what a great idea!     ***   The one thing that bothers me about this app is the swap, roll, and drop locations. I feel the swap key should be the second function of the drop key. I also feel that having a roll key isn't very useful without a reverse roll key. (As the hp 15c has.) So a reverse roll second function for the roll key would be great! All this would allow for much easier stack manipulation (not to mention blazing fast calculations!).      ***   Also a dynamic stack would be especially useful for all those statistics functions (just say'n).     ***   I try to only pay for apps from developers who write back, so that I know that they are active. I am very interested in supporting this app.

Hands down best calculator on the market! I was in need of a good scientific calculator and of all of them on the market, this one was by far the best. It is a simple task to read the very clean interface and it easily handles all of the advanced calculation I need for my day to day work. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

I've tried all of them. This is the best. I've tried all the RPN calculators out there, even the pricy HP Prime app by HP. This one is the best. Intially 'Paste'  did not appeared on context menu. I thought it was not implemented. Later I found that Paste appears on the menu only if a valid numeric data is present in clipboard. A general rule in user interface is menu items never be hidden, even not be appliable at that moment. Even disabled...Full ReviewIntially 'Paste'  did not appeared on context menu. I thought it was not implemented. Later I found that Paste appears on the menu only if a valid numeric data is present in clipboard. A general rule in user interface is menu items never be hidden, even not be appliable at that moment. Even disabled menu items could be misleading. In this specific case if data can not be parsed as a valid number Paste menu item can inform this. I also found these problems in paste:  - Numbers having hexadecimal digits can not be parsed despite calculator is set in Hex mode.  - White space trimming fails if data have Tab character.  Another problem is the number DDDD DDDD DDDD DDDD does not fit to screen (in portrait). Same for A and C. It is better to use monospace fonts in such applications. Similar problem with large numbers on 64 bit decimal mode. It would be nice if settings have a font size options. Overall a nice calculator with lot of funcionalities.

Wonderful tool As good an RPN calculator as you'll find in the Play Store for your non-programmable requirements. If like this app, the Plus paid version is even better and at a great price. Highly recommended.
